revised_title: Sublethal Effects of Pollution in the Sea: Assessing the Impact on Physiology and Behavior
tldr: This article discusses the effects of sublethal levels of pollutants, such as pesticides and heavy metals, on the physiology and behavior of fish in aquatic ecosystems. The author explores the impacts of pollutants on temperature selection, cold-blocking reflexes, and metabolic rates, suggesting that these changes may lead to long-term ecological consequences.
